page.title: 01WOLVERLEY GAZATTEER
page.content: The grid is in the North West of the county of{Hereford and Worcester}some 3 miles North of the town of{ {Kidderminster. { }It is a mainly rural area of mixed farming with a large area of mainly deciduous woodland in the north much of it comprising{Kingsford {Country Park}. The main residential area is the village of{Wolverley }in the south of the grid. The three other small hamlets of { {Blakeshall},{Drakelow}and{Kingsford} lie to the north of{Wolverley. { }The {River Stour }runs through the grid Southwards to the town of Stourport as does the{Staffordshire {and Worcester Canal. { }The area is well known for its {sandstone caves}.
